Uses of Class
Generation

    • Uses of Generation in <Unnamed>

      Methods in <Unnamed> that return Generation 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Generation Rule.evolve​(Generation gen)
      Creates the next Generation given the current Generation.
      Generation Automaton.getCurrentGeneration()
      This method returns the current generation.
      Generation Automaton.getGeneration​(int stepNum)
      This method shows a certain generation and if it is not as large as stepNum it evolves it to that number.
      Methods in <Unnamed> with parameters of type Generation 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static Automaton Automaton.createAutomaton​(CellularAutomaton ca, int ruleNum, Generation initial)
      This method creates either an Elementary or Totalistic Automaton using enums.
      Generation Rule.evolve​(Generation gen)
      Creates the next Generation given the current Generation.
      boolean[] ElementaryRule.getNeighborhood​(int idx, Generation gen)
      GetNeighborhood gets the cell states of neighbors of the index.
      abstract boolean[] Rule.getNeighborhood​(int idx, Generation gen)
      Retrieves cell states in the neighborhood of the cell with the given index.
      boolean[] TotalisticRule.getNeighborhood​(int idx, Generation gen)
      This method shows the cell states around a given index.
      static boolean[] Rule.getNeighborhoodByRadius​(int idx, int radius, Generation gen)
      Retrieves the next cell states of an index by the radius' value.
